review: As i own a smart TV and so already have amazon prime, youtube and netflix, I purchased Chromecast for the sole purpose of casting tabs from Google Chrome Browser.. rationally figuring that anything i can watch on the laptop or the tablet (Nexus 7), i can watch on the TV.Not so.Tablet:Nexus 7 does not support the casting of Chrome tabs, making the whole "relaxed on the sofa and throwing a video to the TV" largely a joke,Laptop:I have an i5 based laptop, not a slouch by any means, and this only can cast SOME videos, and those only in the small in-page view player. As soon as I attempt full screen mode. the screen goes blank.Bottom line:With pretty much all new TVs being smart, this is an obsolescent device that is worthless until the casting of tabs works seamlessly across phones, tablets (android & ios) and flawlessly from laptops.

review: Well, so far I am pretty happy.Pros:=====- SUPER easy to setup with your phone to enter your wifi network credentials- when you get a good signal, the video quality is excellent- nice screen saver photos when not in use- adding apps much faster now, just found a new one to show photos local to my phone (Avia)- small and portable, and installs out of sight- controls are responsive from the phoneCons:======- playing local phone video doesn't really work, even with Avia because of too high of bit rate- Even with wifi router 10ft away from both it and my phone, it sometimes went into low resolution YouTube mode.  Not sure if that's just YouTube lag?  I have a 12Mbps downlink speed so it's not my Internet.  That speed is verified on the phone over wifi with speedtest app.- I heard my Dad had compatibility issues with his router, but it was old he said so he ordered a new on.  I'll update when I find out more.If I can figure out my YouTube issue, I would make it probably 5 stars.  I love being able to show kids cool videos like SciShow on the family room tv!!!
